alt_text: A high-magnification technical diagram illustrating the microscopic threading schema of Hexenon-M Alpha fibers within a peripheral nerve fascicle during spinal reconstruction.
ocr_text: PROXIMAL NERVE ENDING. DISTAL NERVE ENDING. HEXENON-M ALPHA (5.0Î¼m). FASCICLE BUNDLE. NEURAL GAP: 15mm. INTEGRATION ZONE: 2mm DEPTH. MULTI-THREAD MATRIX.

visual_elements.label: Neural Fascicle
visual_elements.description: Cross-section of the nerve bundle shown in light pink, with individual axons visible as microscopic dots.

visual_elements.label: Hexenon-M Alpha Threads
visual_elements.description: Six ultra-thin gray lines representing the 5.0-micron carbon nanotube threads bridging the 15mm neural gap.

visual_elements.label: Integration Zone
visual_elements.description: Shaded green area extending 2mm into both nerve endings, indicating where the peptide-coated threads are woven into native tissue to ensure bio-mechanical stability.

visual_elements.label: Signal Direction Vectors
visual_elements.description: Glowing blue pulses traveling along the Hexenon-M threads, representing electrical signal fidelity across the bridge.
